verb.description: (especially of a bird) move rapidly downwards through the air.
examples: the barn owl can swoop down on a mouse in total darkness
the aircraft swooped in to land
she swooped up the hen in her arms

noun.description: A swooping or snatching movement or action.
examples: four members were arrested following a swoop by detectives on their homes

origin: Mid 16th century (in the sense sweep along in a stately manner): perhaps a dialect variant of Old English swāpan (see sweep). The early sense of the noun was a blow, stroke.
